info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 4:47PM CDT until June 15 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN COMANCHE...WEST CENTRAL STEPHENS AND NORTHEASTERN COTTON COUNTIES... At 446 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 5 miles east of Lawton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Eastern Lawton, southeastern Fort Sill, Central High, and Hulen. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 35 and 43. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room, or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
